headline: Rare Necessities
abstract: Stephen Marche on why he collects rare books and why our culture undervalues them.
lead_paragraph: Beneath tight brown paper, inside a bubble-wrapped box, nestled in plastic foam inside another sealed box, inside a package inside a FedEx envelope, the squat book sat — its plain red cover glowing like a battered ember: the first, unauthorized edition of “Religio Medici” by the 17th-century physician and writer’s writer Thomas Browne. It’s mine. I own it.
